function:
def priority(item: float, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """Returns priority with which we want to add item to each bin.

    Args:
        item: Size of item to be added to the bin.
        bins: Array of capacities for each bin.

    Return:
        Array of same size as bins with priority score of each bin.
    """
    priorities = np.zeros_like(bins)
    
    remaining_capacity = bins - item
    utilization_ratio = (bins - remaining_capacity) / bins

    max_utilization = np.max(utilization_ratio)
    min_utilization = np.min(utilization_ratio)
    utilization_range = max_utilization - min_utilization
    
    for i in range(len(bins)):
        if utilization_ratio[i] == max_utilization:
            priorities[i] = 1.0
        elif utilization_ratio[i] == min_utilization:
            priorities[i] = 0.2
        else:
            priorities[i] = 0.2 + 0.6 * (utilization_ratio[i] - min_utilization) / utilization_range
        
        capacity_ratio = (bins[i] - item) / item
        future_capacity = bins[i] - item
        future_utilization = future_capacity / bins[i]
        
        # Adjust priority based on current utilization
        if utilization_ratio[i] < 0.2:
            priorities[i] += 0.4
        elif utilization_ratio[i] < 0.5:
            priorities[i] += 0.3
        elif utilization_ratio[i] > 0.8:
            priorities[i] += 0.2
        
        # Adjust priority based on future impact
        if future_utilization < 0.3:
            priorities[i] += 0.3
        elif future_utilization > 0.8:
            priorities[i] += 0.2
        
        # Additional weight based on capacity ratio
        if capacity_ratio < 0.2:
            priorities[i] += 0.5
        elif capacity_ratio < 0.5:
            priorities[i] += 0.3
        elif capacity_ratio < 0.8:
            priorities[i] += 0.1

    return priorities
